snippet: Prime Minister Nikola Gruevski submitted his resignation on Friday as part of an agreement forged by Johannes Hahn.
abstract: Governing coalition in Macedonia is going ahead with plan brokered by European Union for elections in April, despite threat of boycott by opposition.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Nikola Gruevski submitted his resignation on Friday as part of an agreement forged by Johannes Hahn.

headline.main: Macedonia: Elections Scheduled, but Opposition Threatens Boycott
headline.print_headline: Europe; Macedonia: Elections Scheduled, but Opposition Threatens Boycott
